title: (x) Nokia corporate font - custom font by Erik Spiekermann {Jürgen}
content:
Hi,

Any advise on what font this is? It is a secondary font for Nokia.

Any suggestions are appreciated.

Thanks,

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [whatfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015114716/http:/typophile.com/files/whatfont_0.jpg) | 2.65 KB |

 [‹ Mennen advertising campaign](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015114716/http:/typophile.com/node/15505 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) I want S'more of Yosemite - (similar to) Sixpack/Avon/Apache/Parade {Stephen, Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015114716/http:/typophile.com/node/15533 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jack_monk

comments.content: I first designed the bitmaps for the phone displays, then drew some outlines over these. Ole Schäfer then drew testwords for text weights which i made into complete alphabets, but not complete character sets. I supplied more sketches and weights, and Monotype then finished my rough data, interpolated the hell out of the fonts and delivered production data.

Hello,

Thanks so much for the information.

Much Appreciated!

cheers.
I just posted an illustration on the Type Board forum.
I meant Type ID, but now i am confused. Where did my pdf end up? It’s more than 330k – is that too much? Will it appear, eventually?
Erik — posting images in an already existing thread isn’t yet activated in the new Typophile. Best option is to link to the image on another site, like your blog.

<cite>Best option is to link to the image on another site, like your blog.</cite>

Thanks, Steve. I finally opened a new thread with the illustration, no pdf either. Putting it on my blog means writing copy, properly uploading it, etc. Too much trouble at times. But every week I swear to do better. Like my teachers always wrote in my reports: _Could do better._.
Hey, Erik, don’t you change a bit! We like you just the way you are... :^D

_Putting it on my blog means writing copy, properly uploading it, etc. Too much trouble at times._

I completely relate.
